title: How to Use Coconut Oil As a Conditioner

steps.title: Select an organic, unrefined extra virgin coconut oil.
steps.content: Select an organic, unrefined extra virgin coconut oil. Look on the labels for a coconut oil product that is cold-pressed or expeller-pressed, as these processes extract oil from coconut flakes without any chemicals. Avoid hydrogenated or partially hydrogenated oils. Jars of coconut oil are available in most grocery stores in the cooking/baking aisle near other cooking oils, or in the health food aisle. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Apply once or twice a week.
steps.content: Apply once or twice a week. For best results, use coconut oil as a conditioner 1-2 times a week. Soon, you should notice a difference in the quality and strength of your hair. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Give yourself at least 30 minutes for your conditioning treatment.
steps.content: Give yourself at least 30 minutes for your conditioning treatment. Because the coconut oil needs to set in your hair for at least thirty minutes in order to be effective, it's best to make sure you'll have enough time for the treatment before you begin. Use coconut oil when you know you'll have at least half an hour and up to overnight to leave it in your hair. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Scoop a small amount of coconut oil from the jar.
steps.content: Scoop a small amount of coconut oil from the jar. At room temperature, the oil will be a white, solid material. Use your fingers or a spoon to remove a small clump of oil. Aim for about 1 tablespoon (15 ml) (15 grams) for longer hair, and ½ tablespoon (7 grams) for shorter cuts. Place the oil in a heat resistant container. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Melt the coconut oil.
steps.content: Melt the coconut oil. Place your container of coconut oil in the microwave and cook on high for 30 seconds, or until the coconut oil has turned from a white solid to a clear liquid. Let the container sit for a minute, or until it is cool enough to handle.

steps.title: Use a comb to divide your hair into sections.
steps.content: Use a comb to divide your hair into sections. First, divide your hair into 4 parts, and then split up these parts into ½ - 1 inch (1.5-2.5 cm) wide sections. Use hair clips to help keep these sections apart. It doesn't matter whether your hair is wet or dry for the steps that follow. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use your fingers to massage coconut oil into your hair.
steps.content: Use your fingers to massage coconut oil into your hair. Coat your fingers in the melted coconut oil. Then, starting at the roots of your hair, and moving all the way to the bottom of your strands, massage the oil into the different sections of your hair. Continue rubbing the oil into your hair until all of the oil is absorbed. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Let the oil set in your hair for at least 30 minutes.
steps.content: Let the oil set in your hair for at least 30 minutes. This will allow the oil to absorb into your hair. While 30 minutes is the minimum recommended amount of time, leaving the oil in for 2 hours or more is ideal. You can also leave the oil in your hair overnight. [7] X Research source If you are going to leave the oil in your hair overnight, place a towel over your pillow, and wear a shower cap to avoid making a mess.

steps.title: Use shampoo to remove the oil from your hair.
steps.content: Use shampoo to remove the oil from your hair. After the oil has set in your hair, wash your hair thoroughly. Use a natural shampoo that foams easily; you'll want maximum suds to help cleanse the oil. When you're finished, style your hair as usual. [8] X Research source You might need to shampoo your hair 2-3 times to make sure you've washed all of the oil from your hair. Use a clarifying shampoo if your regular shampoo doesn't work. There is no need to use regular conditioner after you wash with shampoo. The coconut oil will have already done the job!

steps.title: Melt the coconut oil.
steps.content: Melt the coconut oil. Put 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) (15 grams) of oil in a small, heat-proof bowl and melt it in the microwave. Cook on high for about 30 seconds, or until the oil has liquified. Wait a minute for the oil to cool before proceeding to the next step.

steps.title: Combine honey and apple cider vinegar to the melted oil.
steps.content: Combine honey and apple cider vinegar to the melted oil. Mix 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) (15 grams) of both honey and apple cider vinegar with the melted oil. It's fine if the oil appears a bit separated from the other ingredients - just be sure they are combined enough so that each spoonful of your mixture appears somewhat uniform. It's best to use organic honey and vinegar products. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Divide your hair into sections.
steps.content: Divide your hair into sections. Comb your hair into 4 parts, and then split up these parts into ½ - 1 inch (1.5-2.5 cm) wide sections. Secure these sections with hair clips or ties. It doesn't matter whether your hair is wet or dry. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Apply the hair mask to your hair with a hair coloring brush.
steps.content: Apply the hair mask to your hair with a hair coloring brush. If you don't have a hair coloring brush, a clean pastry brush or paint brush will also do the trick. Use the brush to coat each section of hair with the mask, and then massage the mask into your hair with your fingers. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Pull your hair back away from your face.
steps.content: Pull your hair back away from your face. Once all of the coconut oil is absorbed, gather your hair into a high bun to keep it out of the way. Smooth back all loose strands, and secure with an elastic band or a large claw clip. If you want, you can put a shower cap over your hair to keep your oily bun from coming into contact with your skin. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Let the mask sit on your hair for at least 15 minutes.
steps.content: Let the mask sit on your hair for at least 15 minutes. The mask works best when it can set for a couple of hours. The drier your hair is, the longer you should leave in the mask. You should not leave the mask in overnight. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Use shampoo to remove the mask from your hair.
steps.content: Use shampoo to remove the mask from your hair. As with the oil conditioner, you might need to shampoo your hair 2-3 times to make sure you've washed all of the mask from your hair, or you can use a clarifying shampoo. When you're finished, style your hair as usual. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Apply the hair mask about once a month.
steps.content: Apply the hair mask about once a month. The coconut oil hair mask should be used once in a while as a rejuvenating treatment to restore dry or damaged hair. If your hair is especially dry and damaged, you can do this treatment multiple times a month, but no more than once a week, or else your hair will become greasy. [15] X Research source
